Prism.core
Class Port

java.lang.Object
  Prism.core.Brick
      Prism.core.Port
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPort, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ExtensiblePort
public class Port
extends Brick
implements IPort

Port represents locus of communication in Prism.

Version:
2.0
Author:
USC Soft. Arch. Group. Contact: Sam Malek malek@usc.edu
See Also:

Port

public Port(int pPortType,
            Brick pBrick)
Port constructor.

Parameters:
pPortType - PortType which could either be Request or Reply.
pBrick - parent of this Port. Usually a Component/Connector.

Returns:
DynamicArray List of available ports

getPortType

public int getPortType()
Description copied from interface: IPort
Returns the type of port. A port could be either of type Request, Reply or both. Request is equivalent to the notion of Top in C2. Reply is equivalent to the notion of Bottom in C2.

Specified by:
getPortType in interface IPort
Returns:
int port type

Description copied from interface: IPort
Returns the parent brick of this Port.

Specified by:

Returns:
Brick parent Brick

getExtensiblePort

public ExtensiblePort getExtensiblePort()
Description copied from interface: IPort
In situations when the Port is actually more specialized and is an ExtensiblePort, this method returns the ExtensiblePort.

Specified by:
getExtensiblePort in interface IPort
Returns:
ExtensiblePort child ExtensiblePort

public void setExtensiblePort(ExtensiblePort pExtPort)

Specified by:
setExtensiblePort in interface IPort

pExtPort - child ExtensiblePort
